labels.analysis: The MCP Server serves as an integration platform that allows applications to interact with real-world data sources (files, databases, APIs) while leveraging language models to automate workflows. The available tools (BMI calculation and weather fetching) indicate functionality around health/analysis and environment/data retrieval, though the primary focus seems to be on providing a standardized interface for accessing diverse data sources and automating tasks.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "API Integration" is chosen because the server's core function is to provide tools and methods for accessing various data sources (files, databases, APIs) in a standardized way. "Data Analysis & Processing" is a secondary label due to the presence of calculation tools (like BMI) and data retrieval functions (like weather). These reflect the server's role in collecting and processing data. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories adequately cover the functionality.

tools.name: calculate_bmi
tools.description: Calculate BMI given weight in kg and height in meters

tools.name: fetch_weather
tools.description: Fetch current weather for a city

server_info_crawled.name: Model Context Protocol Server
server_info_crawled.author: @kim-geon-admin/mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Integrate your applications with real-world data and tools seamlessly. Access files, databases, and APIs while leveraging the power of language models to enhance your workflows. Simplify complex interactions and automate tasks with a standardized approach.

tools.name: calculate_bmi
tools.description: Calculate BMI given weight in kg and height in meters

tools.name: fetch_weather
tools.description: Fetch current weather for a city

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@kim-geon-admin/mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
